bug.author: yhn112
bug.summary: Parameter "device" in SupervisedRunner has no effect
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug Report</denchmark-h>
When running with device=torch.device('cuda:0') or device='cuda:0' model still uses all the GPUs. When running with device=torch.device('cpu') or device='cpu' an error RuntimeError: module must have its parameters and buffers on device cuda:0 (device_ids[0]) but found one of them on device: cpu appears. <denchmark-h:h3>How To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run any sort of training using SupervisedRunner(device=torch.device('cpu')) or SupervisedRunner(device=torch.device('cuda:0')) on a machine with multiple GPUs. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>PyTorch version: 1.5.0 OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Python version: 3.7 CUDA runtime version: 10.2``` </denchmark-code>
